description: "The series of events required for a bitter taste stimulus to be received and converted to a molecular signal." [GOC:go_curators]
name: detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of bitter taste

description: "The series of events required to receive a bitter taste stimulus, convert it to a molecular signal, and recognize and characterize the signal. This is a neurological process." [GOC:ai]
name: sensory perception of bitter taste

description: "The series of events involved in the perception of taste in which a gustatory chemical stimulus is received and converted into a molecular signal." [GOC:ai]
name: detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of taste

description: "The series of events required for an organism to receive a gustatory stimulus, convert it to a molecular signal, and recognize and characterize the signal. Gustation involves the direct detection of chemical composition, usually through contact with chemoreceptor cells. This is a neurological process." [GOC:ai]
name: sensory perception of taste
